description:
Course Description

“Every time you borrow money, you're robbing your future self."

― Nathan W. Morris, Economist

“The number one problem in today's generation and economy is the lack of financial literacy"

- Alan Greenspan, Former Chairman of US Federal Reserve

Do you want to improve your financial literacy?

Do you want to know which credit card to get?

Do you want to know how to use credit cards?

Do you want to know how your credit score really works?

Do you want to know how to avoid credit card debt?

Do you want to know a key part to obtaining financial freedom?

If so, then this is the right course for you!

It's a short and practical course on debit cards, credit cards and credit scores that will lay the foundation of your financial literacy:

  • Understand the benefits of both debit cards and credit cards
  • Learn about the key differences of debit cards and credit cards
  • Know when to get your first credit card
  • Learn how to compare and contrast different types of credit cards
  • Understand what it means to have good credit and how to get there
  • Compare minimum payment options with credit cards
  • Learn how to clear up an error on your Credit Report
  • Be able to make your own financial decisions around your credit cards based on learned financial literacy

In this short, but effective course you will learn all you need to know about Debit Cards, Prepaid Cards, Credit Cards, Credit Scores, Credit Payments and Credit Reports. Learn the subtleties of personal finance from someone who has expertise in the field. Get ahead of the curve in financial literacy and make a truly positive difference in your life!

The instructor of this course has extensive experience in the world of finance:

  • Worked for several years on Wall Street at the top Investment Banks within the Retail Investing and Private Banking divisions.
  • Has experience working with retail and corporate clients, as well as high-net-worth individuals

By the completion of this course you will:

  • Know what comprises your credit score
  • What measures to take to ensure a high (more desirable) credit score
  • Where to obtain a FREE Credit Report
  • Know when the right time is for you to get a credit card
  • Understand how to evaluate different credit card options
  • Know why paying minimum monthly payments can land you in unwanted debt

About the course:

  • No previous experience is needed in order to understand the course well and fully benefit from its content
  • You can always contact us for any clarification completely free of charge
  • The goal is to take your financial literacy skills to the next level

This course is the first in a series of courses designed at teaching and solidifying one's personal financial literacy. Specifically this course is suitable for those who want to learn more about obtaining credit and the functionality of credit cards. You can never rely on others to make important choices on your behalf. Acquire the tools that will allow you to make the confident decisions required to be independent and successful!

So what are you waiting for? Just go ahead and subscribe to this course! If you don't acquire these skills now, you will miss an opportunity to separate yourself from the others. Don't risk your financial future! Let's start learning!

What are the requirements?

  • NONE! You are already qualified!

What am I going to get from this course?

  • 13 lectures and 1 hour of content!
  • Understand the benefits of both debit cards and credit cards
  • Learn about the key differences of debit cards and credit cards
  • Know when to get your first credit card
  • Learn how to compare and contrast different types of credit cards
  • Understand what it means to have good credit and how to get there
  • Compare minimum payment options with credit cards
  • Learn how to clear up an error on your Credit Report
  • Be able to make your own financial decisions around your credit cards based on learned financial literacy
